course_title: Spec Tops: Political Science: Contemporary Russia
class_notes:
(Same as RUSS 375W 1, IDS 385W 5)
This class meets synchronously online on Tuesdays and Thursdays.
This interdisciplinary course examines the birth of the new Russian culture after the break-up of the Soviet Union from the late 1980s to the present. The questions raised will be as follows. What makes Russia a unique historical phenomenon so visible in contemporary politics, culture, and international relations? How is contemporary Russian culture shaped by its interactions with society, politics, and the historical past? Topics range from politics and ideology to literature and visual arts, including  discussions of religious diversity,  the fate of the intelligentsia, and media evolution. Major intellectual and artistic trends will be considered.
course_description: Selected topics and problems in political science. Content will vary in successive offerings of this course. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
